provenance.name: Cumberland Papers
provenance.note: George Cumberland; bequeathed to his son, George Cumberland; presented to the British Library in 1849, as part of the Cumberland Papers consisting of thirty-one volumes and two rolls, on condition that these should not be opened until 1900.

desc.objtitle: I congratulate you not on any atchievement, object 1

objnote.p: Blake's letter is written on one side of a single leaf (object 1). The reverse side bearing the address is not photographed. The full sheet was folded to form a sealed packet for posting. A hole is torn through the paper along the middle of object 1 from lines 8-10 where the seal was opened, removing several words.
Two inscriptions in an unknown hand appear on object 1: the British Library folio number "51" in the top left corner, and the number "52", oriented vertically, in the bottom right corner.

lg.l: Lambeth
6 December 1795
Dear Sir
I congratulate you not on any atchievementachievement. because I
know that the Genius that produces. these Designs can execute
them in any manner. notwithstanding the pretended Philosophy
which teaches that Execution is the power of One & Invention of

Another __ Locke says it i same faculty that Invents Bentley (Writings volume 2, page 1522), Erdman (page 699), and Keynes (Letters, page 5) propose, in brackets, "it i[s the] same" for the text removed by the hole that runs through this line.

Judges, & I say he who Invent can Execute.Bentley (Writings volume 2, page 1522), Erdman (page 699), and Keynes (Letters, page 5) read across this gap in the text: "he who [can] Invent". This reading is further supported by the fragment of visible script, detail image above, that is still attached to the seal at the bottom of the page and appears to include the "an" of "[c]an".
As to laying on the Wasx it is as follows
Take a cake of Virgins Wax (I dont know What animal produces it)
& stroke it regularly over the surface of a warm Plate. (the Plate
must be warm enough to melt the Wax as it passes over) thenBlake appears to have added an ascender to correct the poorly formed initial "W" of "Wax".
immediately draw a feather overver it & you will get an even surfaceBlake appears to have rewritten the final three letters of "over" to correct the poorly formed characters.
which when cold will recieve any impression minutely
Note The danger is in not covering the Plate All over
Now You will I hope shew all the family of Antique
Borers. that Peace & Plenty & Domestic Happiness is the Source
of Sublime Art. & prove to the Abstract Philosophers. that
Enjoyment & not Abstinence is the food of Intellect"Intellect" is written over the remnants of an illegible word that was scratched out.
Yours Sincerely
Will Blake
Health to Mrs Cumberland & family
The pressure necessary to roll off the lines is the same as when you
print, or not quite so great.. I have not been able to send
a proof of the bath tho I have done the corrections. my paper
not being in order
